Melissa McKnight is an English-American actress and model who was the ex-wife of Matt LeBlanc. Her main acting roles include Triangles, Tribulations and VH1: All Access.

Melissa McKnight is estimated to have a net worth of $1 million in 2021. She can earn approximately $56,000 a year as an actress.

As a result, Melissa Mcknight has also witnessed an increase in her net worth, although the details of her divorce settlement with ex-husband Matt LeBlanc are unknown.

She was married to Matt LeBlanc, who played Joey Tribbiani on Friends and is one of the richest actors in Hollywood. It is estimated that her net worth is around $80 million.

Is Melissa Mcknight single? Relationship

Despite having been married twice previously, Melissa Mcknight, 56, appears to be unmarried at the moment.

In 1990 she married for the first time to Anthony Robert Esposito. The couple welcomed a son the following year, whom they named Tyler Esposito. After four years of marriage, they welcomed a daughter, Jacqueline Esposito.

They separated for personal reasons a year after welcoming their second child.

In 1997, a mutual acquaintance, Kelly Diamond Phillips, introduced them to actor Matt LeBlanc.

They began dating shortly after meeting and Matt proposed in 1999. On May 3, 2003, they were married in Hawaii’s Waipio Valley, atop the cliffs.

Marina Pearl LeBlanc was born on February 8, 2004, after two years of marriage. Marina suffered postpartum seizures when she was eight months old, which caused a condition known as dysplasia.

On October 6, 2006, the couple filed for divorce after three years of marriage.

The former model allegedly started dating an unknown man after getting divorced, however, the relationship has just begun. The Friends star is currently dating Aurora Mulligan, on the other hand.

How did Melissa Mcknight start her professional career?

Mellissa began her career as a model and during her career she participated in beauty advertisements for several well-known companies. She has also appeared on magazine covers.

She made her acting debut in the 2001 film Triangles and Tribulations. Her performance on VH1: All Access in 2001 was praised. She made her theatrical debut in 2005 at the 31st Annual People Choice Awards.
